title: Fairly heavy rains expected in several areas
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, North-western and Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (23).

title: “Bleed with dignity”: Anudi Gunasekara among finalists of Head-to-Head challenge at Miss World 2025
byline: Anudi Gunasekara of Sri Lanka has secured a spot among the final 20 contestants in the Miss World Head-to-Head Challenge, following a powerful first round that spotlighted eloquence, compassion, and global awareness from 107 young women around the world.

title: IMF awaits Sri Lanka’s electricity tariff adjustments to approve fourth review?
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) says that the approval for the fourth review of Sri Lanka’s programme under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) is contingent on the government completing prior actions, including restoring electricity cost recovery pricing.

title: 12-hour water cut in Colombo and suburbs on Sunday
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced a 12-hour water cut from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. on Sunday (May 25) in several areas including Colombo.

title: 8 arrested in Chilaw with Rs. 18 million in suspected drug money
byline: Police have arrested eight individuals at Thoduwawa in Chilaw along with Rs. 18 million in cash, suspected to have been earned from transporting and selling narcotics.

title: Trump administration bars Harvard from enrolling international students
byline: The Trump administration on Thursday revoked Harvard University’s ability to enroll international students, delivering a sharp punishment to the elite institution for refusing to bow to the administration’s policy demands.

title: Committee appointed to probe Dayasiri’s behaviour in Parliament
byline: A three-member committee has been appointed to investigate the incident related to the conduct and behaviour of MP Dayasiri Jayasekara in Parliament on May 20, the Speaker of the House Dr. Jagath Wickremerathna announced.

title: PM Harini meets US Ambassador and USAID delegation to discuss future development cooperations
byline: The Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, held a meeting on Thursday (22) at the Parliament with U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie J. Chung and Acting Mission Director and Programme Office Director for USAID Sri Lanka and Maldives Maureen Hsia.

title: Ven. Ampitiye Sumanarathana Thero arrested
byline: The Chief Incumbent of Sri Mangalarama Viharaya in Batticaloa, Ven. Ampitiye Sumanarathana Thero has been arrested by police following an incident of disorderly conduct at the Ampara Police Station

title: MP Chaminda Wijesiri steps down as SJB’s Bandarawela Organiser
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Badulla District Parliamentarian Chaminda Wijesiri has decided to step down from his position as the party’s Bandarawela Constituency Organiser.

title: Sri Lanka to induct largest-ever batch of nurses tomorrow
byline: The Ministry of Health and Mass Media has announced that letters of appointment will be officially presented to 3,147 new recruits to Sri Lanka’s nursing service tomorrow (24).

title: Miss Indonesia wins talent final at Miss World 2025
byline: In a spectacular celebration of global artistry and cultural diversity, the 72nd Miss World Festival marked one of its most anticipated events – Miss World Talent Final – held yesterday at the esteemed Shilpakala Vedika in Hyderabad, Telangana.

title: Duminda Dissanayake arrested over ‘gold-plated’ T-56 firearm
byline: Former Minister and Anuradhapura District Organiser of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), Duminda Dissanayake, has been arrested by police.

title: Angelo Mathews to retire from Test cricket
byline: Former Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews will retire from Test cricket after the first match against Bangladesh, the veteran all-rounder announced in a statement on Friday.

title: Dr. Nihal Abeysinghe appointed Chairman of SOC on Health, Media and Women Empowerment
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Dr. Nihal Abeysinghe has been elected as the Chairman of the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Health, Media and Women’s Empowerment.

title: President Dissanayake to visit Germany on June 10
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to visit Germany on June 10 for an official state visit.

title: OpenAI to build world’s largest AI data centre in UAE
byline: OpenAI unveiled plans on Thursday to build a massive computing complex in the United Arab Emirates, The New York Times reported.

title: Ven. Ampitiye Sumanarathana Thero granted bail
byline: The Chief Incumbent of Sri Mangalarama Viharaya in Batticaloa, Ven. Ampitiye Sumanarathana Thero, has been granted bail following his arrest by police earlier today.

title: 16 Police OICs receive transfers and new appointments
byline: The National Police Commission has approved the immediate transfers and new appointments for 16 Officers-in-Charge (OICs) of police stations and divisions within Sri Lanka Police.

title: DMT Deputy Commissioner, 2 officials arrested with Rs. 4M in suspected bribes
byline: A Deputy Commissioner and two officials of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) have been arrested by officers of the Bribery Commission for the possession of Rs. 4 million in cash, believed to have been collected from soliciting bribes.

title: Muslim schools closed on June 6 and 9 for Hajj festival
byline: The Ministry of Education announced that all Muslim schools across the island will remain closed on June 06 (Friday) and June 09 (Monday), in view of the Hajj festival.

title: Prof. Indika Karunathilake appointed Vice-Chancellor of Colombo Uni.
byline: Professor Indika Karunathilake has been appointed as the new Vice-Chancellor of the University of Colombo by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Trump threatens 50% tariffs on EU and 25% penalties on Apple as trade war intensifies
byline: US President Donald Trump on Friday threatened a 50% tax on all imports from the European Union as well a 25% tariff on Apple products unless iPhones are made in America.

title: Sri Lankan delegation to engage in tariff talks in Washington DC
byline: A Sri Lankan delegation is set to participate in discussions in Washington, D.C., focusing on tariff-related matters, following an invitation extended by the Office of the United States Trade Representative (USTR).

title: Speaker endorses certificate on Foreign Loans (Repeal) Bill
byline: The Speaker of the Parliament (Dr.) Jagath Wickramaratne has endorsed the certificate on the Foreign Loans (Repeal) Bill today (23) in Parliament.
